intro: Hippocrepandra lurida, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a terrestrial orchid with a unique appearance, featuring pale green or white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions. The plant has a short, horizontal stem and produces small, delicate blooms that are often difficult to spot in its natural habitat. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in pine flatwoods and wetlands. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a protected species in many areas.
